IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF KSI IS TO ASSIST PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN THE PURSUIT OF THEIR POTENTIAL IN EMPLOYMENT AND MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: KSI PROVIDES LIFE ENRICHMENT AND EMPLOYMENT SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. THESE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN BOTH COMMUNITY AND IN THE SKILL DEVELOPMENT CENTER. KSI ALSO PROVIDES EVALUATION, PLACEMENT AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR OUR PARTICIPANTS.
IRS990.Desc: KSI BUSINESS SERVICES - KSI PROVIDES PRODUCTION SERVICES AND COMMUNITY-BASED CONTRACT LABOR FOR BUSINESSES IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AS A WAY TO PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. PARTICIPANTS IN OUR PRE-VOCATIONAL SERVICES AND SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMS ARE ALL PAID AT LEAST MINIMUM WAGES OR HIGHER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: REHABILITATION SERVICES - KSI PROVIDES THE SUPPORT AND CASE MANAGEMENT THAT ALLOWS DISABLED EMPLOYEES TO WORK, LEARN AND BECOME MORE FULLY ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. COMMUNITY-BASED EMPLOYMENT - KSI PROVIDES FULLY-SUPERVISED WORK CREWS TO PERFORM ONGOING PROJECTS AT THE CUSTOMERS' OWN FACILITIES. THESE CREWS ARE TRULY-INTEGRATED OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS TO APPLY AND GROW THEIR EMPLOYMENT SKILLS. AS THE EMPLOYER, KSI IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL EMPLOYMENT-RELATED EXPENSES, INCLUDING PAYROLL ADMINISTRATION, PAYROLL TAXES AND EMPLOYMENT-RELATED INSURANCES. THE BUSINESSES BENEFITTING FROM KSI WORK CREWS GAIN DEDICATED EMPLOYEES AND UNIQUELY-EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS TO THEIR PRODUCTION ISSUES THAT CAN'T BE FOUND ELSEWHERE.SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT - INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO SEEK GREATER INDEPENDENCE CAN USE KSI'S HELP TO FIND, APPLY AND TRAIN FOR JOBS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. KSI EMPLOYMENT SPECIALISTS START WITH ASSESSMENTS IN REAL-WORLD WORKPLACES TO UNDERSTAND INDIVIDUALS' PREFERRED JOB CHOICES. THEN KSI HELPS DEVELOP CUSTOMIZED JOBS, MATCHING EMPLOYEES TO MEET EMPLOYERS' NEEDS. WHEN INDIVIDUALS ARE PLACED IN JOBS AND ACCLIMATED, KSI PROVIDES FOLLOW-ALONG SUPPORT FOR SUCCESS THROUGHOUT THE INDIVIDUAL'S ENTIRE TERM OF EMPLOYMENT WITHIN THAT JOB. KSI ALSO PROVIDES EARLY START TO SUPPORTED EMPLOYMENT FOR YOUNG PEOPLE TRANSITIONING OUT OF SCHOOL, HELPING THEM FIND JOBS MORE QUICKLY.PREVOCATIONAL SERVICES - PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD SKILLS AND CONFIDENCE FOR WORKPLACE READINESS IS CRUCIAL. KSI HELPS INDIVIDUALS BY ASSESSING JOB GOALS AND PROVIDING CUSTOMIZED TRAINING TO PREPARE THEM FOR COMMUNITY-INTEGRATED EMPLOYMENT. PREVOCATIONAL SERVICES PROVIDE OUR PARTICIPANTS WITH THE SUPPORT THEY NEED TO UNDERSTAND AND PREPARE FOR THE WORKPLACE. IT ALSO OFFERS PARTICIPANTS EARNING OPPORTUNITIES, MOTIVATING THEM TO REACH HIGHER. AS PART OF PREVOCATIONAL TRAINING, KSI'S SKILL DEVELOPMENT CENTER IN MILFORD HAS THE CAPACITY TO HANDLE NUMEROUS DEADLINE-DRIVEN PRODUCTION, ASSEMBLY AND MAILING PROJECTS AT THE SAME TIME. AND BUSINESSES CAN UTILIZE THIS AFFORDABLE RESOURCE TO HELP ACHIEVE THEIR GOALS. KSI LIFE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM - THE LIFE ENRICHMENT PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO AID INDIVIDUALS IN SELF DISCOVERY AND EMPOWER THEM FOR MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. LIFE ENRICHMENT PARTICIPANTS BENEFIT FROM OPPORTUNITIES TO LEARN SKILLS, VOLUNTEER, CONTRIBUTE AND ACCESS COMMUNITY LIFE AND RESOURCES. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES NON-EMPLOYMENT ACTIVITIES TO HELP PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE NOT FOCUSED ON WORK PLACEMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: TRANSPORTATION - KSI PROVIDES DOOR-TO-DOOR TRANSPORTATION THAT ALLOWS THOSE WE SERVE TO ACCESS OUR EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING SERVICES. KSI VEHICLES TRAVEL OVER 1 MILLION MILES EACH YEAR THROUGHOUT KENT AND SUSSEX COUNTIES AND PROVIDE ROUGHLY 110,000 TRIPS ANNUALLY FOR THE PEOPLE WE SERVE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CAFETERIA - PROVIDES MEALS TO DISABLED ADULTS.
OTHER PROGRAMS DIRECTLY RELATED TO EXEMPT FUNCTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOBBYING EFFORTS INCLUDE 39,943. THE LOBBYING EXPENDITURES INCLUDE AMOUNTS PAID TO PROFESSIONAL IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,580 AND ALLOCABLE PORTION OF SELECTED EMPLOYEES TIME OF $9,363 FOR TOTAL OF $39,943.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: PRESIDENT OF L&W ALSO A BOD MEMBER
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: L&W INSURANCE BROKERS PROPERTY, CASUALTY, AND WORKERS COMPENSATION INSURANCE FOR KENT-SUSSEX INDUSTRIES. THE TOTAL VALUE LISTED INCLUDES INSURANCE PREMIUMS AND THE RELATED COMMISSIONS FOR THESE COVERAGES. COMMISSIONS FOR THESE COVERAGES ARE PAID TO ANOTHER BROKER IN THE L&W INSURANCE BROKERAGE FIRM WHO IS NOT A KSI BOARD MEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VICE-PRESIDENT OF OPERATIONS, JAYSON CROUCH, IS THE BROTHER OF KSI CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, B. CRAIG CROUCH. THERE ARE NO RELATED-PARTY BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN THE TWO BROTHERS. THERE ARE NO OTHER RELATED-PARTY TRANSACTIONS WITH ANY FORMER OR CURRENT EMPLOYEE OR DIRECTOR OR THE RELATIVE OF SAME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO REVIEW WAS OR WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.THE 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE COMPTROLLER AND CEO PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW AND VERIFY COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY. IF AN EMPLOYEE FAILS TO COMPLY WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, THE CEO WILL DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE ACTION, IF ANY, TO BE TAKEN. IN THE EVENT THE FAILURE TO COMPLY IS ON THE PART OF THE CEO OR A DIRECTOR, KSI'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS WILL DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE ACTION TO BE TAKEN, IF ANY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE IS AN INDEPENDENT REVIEW OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION USING COMPARATIVE DATA. THIS REVIEW IS PERFORMED BY THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITHOUT KEY EMPLOYEE INVOLVEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DRAFT AUDITED FINANCIALS ARE REVIEWED BY CEO AND CONTROLLER PRIOR TO FINALIZATION.
